intro: Illicium ekmanii subsp. ekmanii, commonly known as the Philippine star anise, is a species of flowering plant in the family Schisandraceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its aromatic, star-shaped fruit that resembles the more well-known star anise. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a slightly serrated margin, while its flowers are small and greenish-white in color. The fruit, which contains several seeds, is used in traditional medicine and has a strong, licorice-like aroma.
